trending.reason: Major $25B investment in global AI infrastructure by OpenAI, placing Argentina at the forefront.
Foundational breakthrough in distributed quantum computing, enabling processors to link.
A compelling new theory that potentially solves a 4,500-year-old mystery.

articles.title: This Week in Robotics: Rise of Humanoid Robots
articles.excerpt: A review of the latest developments in robotics, including Figure AI's introduction of its third-generation humanoid robot, Figure 03.
articles.author: Alper Konuralp
articles.fullContent:
Humanoid Robots and Chinese Dominance Lead Robotics News

The robotics industry saw significant developments this week, highlighted by the introduction of next-generation humanoid robots from Figure AI and Deep Robotics. These advancements coincide with a new analysis revealing China's overwhelming dominance in the sector, where it installed more factory robots in 2024 than the rest of the world combined. The week underscores a global acceleration in both the sophistication and deployment of robotic systems.

The New Wave of Humanoid Robots

Figure AI officially introduced Figure 03, its latest humanoid robot designed for practical, real-world applications. The company showcased the robot's ability to perform complex household and logistical tasks, signalling a shift from laboratory prototypes to commercially viable machines. This development is part of a broader trend of increasingly capable humanoid robots entering the market.

China's Manufacturing Powerhouse

An analysis from the Washington Post detailed China's massive scale-up in robotics. In 2024, China installed approximately 300,000 robots in its factories, and now operates over 2 million robots in total — five times the number in the United States. This surge is attributed to the "Made in China 2025" campaign, which has successfully boosted domestic manufacturers to a 57% market share through substantial state support.

Broader Industry Movements

Beyond hardware, MIT announced a new artificial intelligence training system aimed at accelerating AI development. In the logistics space, Serve Robotics deployed its thousandth delivery robot and secured a major partnership with DoorDash, further cementing the role of autonomous systems in everyday commerce. These events collectively point to a rapidly maturing industry with major implications for labour, manufacturing, and daily life.

Key Takeaways

  • Humanoid Advancements: Figure AI unveiled its next-generation Figure 03 robot, built for real-world tasks.
  • China's Dominance: China now installs and operates more industrial robots than the rest of the world combined.
  • AI and Logistics Growth: MIT is developing new AI training systems while autonomous delivery deployments are expanding rapidly.

articles.title: Solo Leveling: Ragnarok Print Release Confirmed
articles.excerpt: IZE Press has confirmed that the sequel manhwa, Solo Leveling: Ragnarok, will receive a physical print release, with the first volume scheduled for June 2026.
articles.author: CBR
articles.fullContent:
'Solo Leveling: Ragnarok' Secures US Print Release

The sequel to the popular manhwa 'Solo Leveling' is officially getting an English-language print edition. Yen Press announced at New York Comic-Con 2025 that it has acquired the print license for 'Solo Leveling: Ragnarok' and will publish it under its K-comics imprint, Ize Press. The first volume is scheduled for release in the United States in June 2026.

A New Generation's Story

The sequel follows the story of Sung Suho, the son of the original series protagonist Sung Jinwoo and Cha Haein. As Suho discovers his inherited powers, he must contend with the significant legacy his father left behind. The story was originally released as a web novel by author Daul and was later adapted into a manhwa with art by REDICE Studio, the same studio behind the original series.

From Digital to Physical

Prior to this announcement, English-speaking fans could only access 'Solo Leveling: Ragnarok' digitally through platforms like Tapas. The move to a physical format marks a significant step for the series, making it accessible to a broader audience and collectors. The decision follows the immense success of the original 'Solo Leveling' manhwa, which recently topped the New York Times' bestsellers list for graphic books.

Debate Over Canon

While Ize Press is marketing 'Ragnarok' as the official sequel, the original author of 'Solo Leveling,' Chugong, has recently clarified that he views it more as a spin-off or an alternate universe story. He has also stated that he is considering writing his own direct sequel to the main plot, which has created some debate among fans about the canonical status of Sung Suho's story.

Key Takeaways

  • US Release Confirmed: 'Solo Leveling: Ragnarok' will get an official English print release in June 2026 from publisher Ize Press.
  • New Protagonist: The sequel focuses on Sung Suho, the son of original protagonist Sung Jinwoo.
  • Digital First: The manhwa was previously only available in English on digital platforms like Tapas.
  • Canon Controversy: Original author Chugong considers 'Ragnarok' a spin-off and may write his own official sequel.

articles.title: OpenAI & Sur Energy to Build $25B AI Data Center
articles.excerpt: OpenAI and Sur Energy are collaborating to build a $25 billion AI data center in Argentina, aiming to enhance global AI infrastructure.
articles.author: Times Of AI
articles.fullContent:
OpenAI Announces $25 Billion Data Centre Project in Argentina

OpenAI and Argentinian company Sur Energy have signed a letter of intent to construct a massive artificial intelligence data centre in Argentina, with a potential investment of up to $25 billion. The project, named 'Stargate Argentina', was confirmed by the Argentine government and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, and represents one of the largest technology infrastructure initiatives in the country's history.

A Hub for AI Computing

The proposed facility is designed to be a large-scale operation with a capacity of up to 500 megawatts, aimed at providing the significant computing power required for developing and training advanced AI models. The project is structured under Argentina's RIGI tax incentive program, which is designed to attract large foreign investments. The development will position Argentina as a key player in the global AI ecosystem.

"We are proud to announce plans to launch Stargate Argentina, an exciting new infrastructure project... We are excited to work with Argentina as it builds to become an AI hub for all of Latin America." - Sam Altman, CEO, OpenAI

Strategic Importance for Latin America

Sam Altman highlighted the strategic significance of the project, noting it will be the company's first 'Stargate' initiative in Latin America. He emphasised the region's talent and creativity as key factors in the decision. The investment underscores the growing global demand for AI infrastructure and OpenAI's efforts to expand its operational footprint to support its rapidly growing services, such as ChatGPT, which now has over 800 million weekly users.

Future Outlook

If completed, the data centre will not only boost Argentina's technological capabilities but also create a critical hub for AI development across Latin America. The partnership between a leading AI research lab and a major energy company highlights the immense energy requirements of modern AI and the need for integrated solutions to power the future of the technology.

Key Takeaways

  • Massive Investment: OpenAI and Sur Energy plan to build a $25 billion AI data centre in Argentina.
  • High Capacity: The facility will have a capacity of up to 500 megawatts to power advanced AI computing.
  • First in Latin America: This is OpenAI's first major 'Stargate' infrastructure project in the region.
  • Economic Impact: The project is one of the largest technology and energy initiatives in Argentina's history.

articles.title: Scientists Teleport Data Using Quantum Supercomputers
articles.excerpt: Scientists have successfully shared data instantaneously between two quantum computers using quantum entanglement, a major step for distributed quantum computing.
articles.author: BGR
articles.fullContent:
Scientists Achieve Quantum Teleportation Between Computers

Researchers have successfully teleported data between two separate quantum computers, a breakthrough that paves the way for powerful distributed quantum computing. The experiment, detailed in the journal *Nature*, did not move physical matter but instead transferred quantum information instantaneously using the principle of quantum entanglement. This allowed the two processors to function as a single, more powerful, interconnected supercomputer.

Harnessing Quantum Entanglement

The process relies on quantum entanglement, a phenomenon where two particles become linked in such a way that their states remain connected no matter the distance separating them. The team from the University of Oxford wirelessly sent a quantum algorithm from one processor to the other, enabling the machines to share information and pool their resources without any physical particles travelling between them. This marks the first time logical gates, the fundamental components of an algorithm, have been teleported across a network link.

The Dawn of a Quantum Internet

This achievement is a crucial step toward creating a 'quantum internet,' an ultra-secure network that can link multiple remote quantum processors. Overcoming the challenge of scaling up individual quantum computers is a major hurdle in the field, as adding more quantum bits (qubits) increases instability. A distributed network of smaller, linked machines offers a more flexible and scalable solution.

"This breakthrough enables us to effectively 'wire together' distinct quantum processors into a single, fully-connected quantum computer." - Dougal Main, University of Oxford

Future Implications

While this is not the teleportation seen in science fiction, it represents a fundamental advance in information technology. A functional quantum internet could revolutionise fields such as cryptography, materials science, and complex simulations by solving problems that are currently impossible for conventional supercomputers to tackle.

Key Takeaways

  • Information, Not Matter: The experiment successfully teleported data in the form of quantum states, not physical objects.
  • Entanglement is Key: The process uses quantum entanglement to link two processors, allowing them to function as a single computer.
  • Distributed Computing: This breakthrough enables a new, more scalable model of quantum computing.
  • Path to Quantum Internet: It is a foundational step towards building a secure and powerful quantum internet.

articles.title: Hydraulics May Have Solved Pyramid Mystery
articles.excerpt: Experts suggest that a hydraulic-powered mechanism may have been used to move the massive stone blocks during the construction of the ancient Egyptian pyramids.
articles.author: indy100
articles.fullContent:
New Theory Suggests Hydraulics Built Egypt's First Pyramid

A groundbreaking new study proposes that the ancient Egyptians used a sophisticated hydraulic lift system to construct the Step Pyramid of Djoser 4,500 years ago. This theory challenges long-held beliefs that brute force and ramps were the primary methods for moving the massive stone blocks, suggesting Egyptian engineers possessed a far more advanced understanding of hydraulic technology than previously thought.

How It May Have Worked

The research, published in *PLOS ONE*, suggests that the pyramid's internal architecture is consistent with a hydraulic elevation mechanism. By funnelling water into a large shaft inside the pyramid, builders could have used water pressure to raise a platform carrying the heavy stones from the base upwards, in what the authors describe as a "volcano fashion". This would have allowed for a more efficient construction process.

Landscape and Infrastructure

The theory is supported by the landscape surrounding the pyramid in Saqqara. Computer models using satellite imagery suggest that a massive nearby enclosure, the Gisr el-Mudir, could have functioned as a check dam to create a temporary lake. This lake would have been connected to a "Dry Moat" around the pyramid, supplying sediment-free water to power the internal lift system.

"Ancient Egyptians are famous for their pioneering and mastery of hydraulics through canals for irrigation purposes and barges to transport huge stones. This work opens a new line of research: the use of hydraulic force to erect the massive structures built by Pharaohs." - Research Authors, via Popular Mechanics

Reshaping Ancient History

If correct, this discovery would significantly push back the timeline for the use of advanced hydraulic technology. It re-frames the construction of the pyramids as not just a marvel of labour, but also of sophisticated engineering and water management. Further research aims to uncover more evidence of these innovative techniques that may have been used to build Egypt's most iconic monuments.

Key Takeaways

  • New Theory: Scientists propose the 4,500-year-old Step Pyramid of Djoser was built using a hydraulic lift.
  • Water-Powered Lift: The system would have used water pressure to raise stone blocks through the pyramid's centre.
  • Supporting Evidence: The surrounding landscape contains structures that could have formed a sophisticated water management system.
  • Historical Significance: The theory suggests ancient Egyptians' understanding of hydraulic engineering was far more advanced than previously known.

articles.title: Star Citizen to Get Third Star System Next Month
articles.excerpt: Developer Cloud Imperium Games has revealed plans for Star Citizen's next major update, Alpha 4.4, which will introduce the game's third star system, Nyx.
articles.author: Simulation Daily
articles.fullContent:
Star Citizen's Universe Expands with Nyx System

Developer Cloud Imperium Games has announced that Star Citizen's third star system, Nyx, will be introduced in the upcoming Alpha 4.4 patch, expected to arrive next month. The reveal was made during the CitizenCon Direct 2025 event, where the studio also outlined future content plans for 2026 and highlighted the game's growing player statistics.

Welcome to the Frontier

The Nyx system is being designed as a frontier region, home to the iconic landing zone of Levski, which is located on the asteroid Delamar. This area is intended to be a hotbed for radicals and anti-UEE sentiment, offering a different style of gameplay compared to the more controlled Stanton system. It is also expected to border hostile Vanduul space, introducing new threats and challenges for players exploring the region.

Phased Rollout and Future Content

The introduction of the Nyx system marks a significant expansion of the playable universe, which has been a long-standing goal for the ambitious space simulation game. Following this release, the development team has plans to continue adding new content and features throughout 2026. This ongoing development is part of the game's open alpha process, where new modules and systems are released incrementally to backers for testing and feedback.

Long-Term Vision

While the addition of a third star system is a major milestone, it is still a step toward the game's ultimate goal of a full 1.0 release. The development of Star Citizen has been a massive undertaking since its record-breaking crowdfunding campaign began. The team continues to work on foundational technologies like server meshing to support a vast, persistent universe for a large number of players.

Key Takeaways

  • New System Announced: Star Citizen will add its third star system, Nyx, in the Alpha 4.4 update next month.
  • Frontier Gameplay: Nyx will feature the returning Levski landing zone and introduce new threats like the Vanduul.
  • Continued Development: Cloud Imperium Games has outlined further content plans for 2026.
  • Alpha Process: The game remains in an early access alpha state, with features being released incrementally.

articles.title: Solo Leveling Author Reveals His Favourite Story Moment
articles.excerpt: In a recent interview, 'Solo Leveling' author Chugong revealed that his favourite scene in the series is not a major battle, but the emotional moment where Jinwoo cries after healing his mother.
articles.author: Game Rant
articles.fullContent:
Author's Favourite Scene Surprises Fans

Chugong, the author of the 'Solo Leveling' web novel, has revealed his favourite moment from the series is the emotionally charged scene where protagonist Sung Jinwoo cries after healing his mother from the Eternal Slumber disease. In an interview with LitRes, Chugong stated that while he enjoyed writing action sequences like the Red Gate Arc, the heartfelt reunion with Jinwoo's mother was the moment that resonated with him the most.

A Moment of Humanity

The scene stands out in a series known for its relentless action and Jinwoo's increasingly stoic demeanour. It is a rare moment that pushes aside his immense power to reveal his underlying humanity and the core motivation for his dangerous journey. This choice surprised many fans, particularly as the scene received some backlash from viewers who felt it detracted from Jinwoo's powerful aura.

Fan Reaction and Author's Insight

The author's selection highlights a contrast between creator intent and audience reception. While many fans are drawn to Jinwoo's incredible power and cool-headedness in battle, Chugong's preference for this quiet, emotional scene suggests he places a high value on the character's personal journey and emotional depth. It serves as a reminder that the story's heart lies not just in the epic fights, but in the personal stakes involved.

Key Takeaways

  • Author's Choice: Chugong's favourite scene is when Jinwoo cries after healing his mother.
  • Emotional Core: The moment highlights Jinwoo's humanity amidst constant battles.
  • Fan Surprise: The selection was unexpected for many fans who focus on the action elements of the series.
  • Creator vs. Audience: It reveals a focus on character-driven moments from the author's perspective.

articles.title: Figure Unveils Humanoid Robot Good at Chores
articles.excerpt: Figure has revealed its new humanoid model, 03, which is designed to help in the home or office and operates on the company's proprietary AI model, Helix.
articles.author: Inc. Magazine
articles.fullContent:
Figure 03 Humanoid Robot Unveiled for Everyday Use

Startup Figure AI has introduced its third-generation humanoid robot, Figure 03, a general-purpose machine capable of performing a wide range of household and workplace chores. In demonstration videos, which the company claims were not remotely operated, the robot is shown tidying rooms, washing dishes, and folding laundry, showcasing a significant leap in autonomous capability.

AI-Powered Operation

The robot's advanced functions are driven by Helix, Figure's proprietary AI system that enables it to understand and execute complex actions in real-time without being pre-scripted. This in-house model links vision, language, and action, allowing users to assign tasks via voice commands. The development of Helix follows the end of a partnership with OpenAI, marking a key step in Figure's technological independence.

Hardware and Sensory Upgrades

Figure 03 features a completely redesigned sensory system. New cameras have doubled the frame rate and expanded the field of view, which is critical for navigating complex environments like a home. Its hands have been upgraded with softer, more adaptive fingertips and integrated palm cameras, allowing for delicate object manipulation and providing visual awareness even when reaching into confined spaces.

"We want the robot to be able to do most things in your home, autonomously, all day... We think we can get there in 2026, but it's a big push." - Brett Adcock, Founder and CEO of Figure

Designed for Mass Production

Unlike previous prototypes, Figure 03 was engineered for high-volume manufacturing from the ground up. Figure has established a new supply chain and manufacturing process at its facility, aiming for an initial production capacity of 12,000 units per year. This focus on scalability signals a strategic move from experimental robotics to deployable products for both commercial and domestic markets.

Key Takeaways

  • Autonomous Chores: Figure 03 can perform household tasks like washing dishes and folding clothes without remote control.
  • Helix AI System: The robot is powered by Figure's in-house AI, allowing it to learn and execute tasks from voice commands.
  • Advanced Hardware: It features an upgraded vision system and tactile hands with palm cameras for improved manipulation.
  • Ready for Scale: Figure 03 is designed for mass manufacturing, with a goal of making humanoid robots a scalable product.

articles.title: Solo Leveling: Ragnarok Gets U.S. Print Release
articles.excerpt: Yen Press has officially announced its acquisition of the print license for Solo Leveling: Ragnarok, with the first volume scheduled for release in the U.S. in June 2026.
articles.author: CBR
articles.fullContent:
Solo Leveling Sequel 'Ragnarok' Secures US Print Deal

Yen Press confirmed it has acquired the print license for the highly anticipated 'Solo Leveling: Ragnarok' manhwa, announcing the news at New York Comic-Con 2025. The first volume is set to be published under its K-comics imprint, Ize Press, and is scheduled for a U.S. release in June 2026. This move finally brings the popular sequel to a print format for English-speaking audiences, who previously could only access it digitally on platforms like Tapas.

A New Generation

The story follows Sung Suho, the son of the original series protagonist Sung Jinwoo and Cha Haein, as he navigates the legacy left by his powerful father. 'Ragnarok' was originally a web novel written by Daul and has been adapted into a manhwa with artwork by JIN and Brix of REDICE Studio, the same studio behind the original series' art.

Is it a Direct Sequel?

While Ize Press is marketing 'Ragnarok' as a continuation, recent comments from the original 'Solo Leveling' author, Chugong, have introduced some ambiguity. Chugong stated that 'Ragnarok' is more like one of many possible scenarios in the 'Solo Leveling' universe, similar to Marvel's parallel universes, and not a direct continuation of his main plot. This has led to some disappointment among fans who considered it the official canon sequel.

Key Takeaways

  • US Release: 'Solo Leveling: Ragnarok' will receive an official English print release in June 2026.
  • Publisher: Yen Press will publish the manhwa under its Ize Press imprint.
  • New Protagonist: The sequel focuses on Sung Suho, the son of Sung Jinwoo.
  • Canon Debate: Original author Chugong has described 'Ragnarok' as an alternate universe story rather than a direct sequel.

articles.title: Growing Demand for 3D Artists in Perth
articles.excerpt: The job market for 3D Artists in Perth is showing strong activity, with multiple vacancies available for various levels of experience in industrial design, animation, and marketing.
articles.author: Seek
articles.fullContent:
Perth's Creative Sector Seeks 3D Artists

Perth's design and architecture sector is actively recruiting 3D artists, with a range of new job opportunities appearing daily. Roles are available for various skill levels, from entry-level to experienced modellers, indicating a healthy demand for CGI professionals in the region. These positions span across industries including architectural visualisation, product design, and animation for marketing campaigns.

Skills in Demand

Employers are seeking candidates proficient in industry-standard software such as 3ds Max, Blender, and Unreal Engine 5. Key responsibilities often involve creating high-quality 3D models from technical drawings, texturing assets, and producing CGI for marketing. Strong portfolios are essential for applicants, and experience with animation and the ability to read architectural plans are highly desirable skills.

Career Opportunities

The available roles offer diverse work arrangements, including full-time, part-time, and casual positions, with some offering flexible or hybrid work models. Companies are looking for passionate individuals to join creative teams and contribute to high-end architectural and product CGI projects. The market shows potential for significant career growth for the right candidates.

Key Points

  • High Demand: Multiple job openings for 3D artists in Perth.
  • Required Skills: Proficiency in Blender, 3ds Max, and Unreal Engine is commonly required.
  • Industry Focus: Opportunities are concentrated in architectural visualisation and product CGI.
  • Flexible Roles: A mix of full-time, part-time, and hybrid work arrangements are available.

articles.title: Solo Leveling Author Clarifies 'Ragnarok' Sequel Status
articles.excerpt: Chugong, the author of Solo Leveling, has clarified that the sequel 'Ragnarok' is not a direct continuation of his story, but rather one of many possible universes for the series.
articles.author: Game Rant
articles.fullContent:
'Ragnarok' Confirmed as an Alternate Universe Story

The author of 'Solo Leveling', Chugong, has clarified the canonical status of the sequel 'Solo Leveling: Ragnarok', revealing it is not a direct continuation of the original plot. In a recent interview, he explained that fans should view 'Ragnarok', which was written by Daul, as one of many possible alternate universes for the series, drawing a comparison to Marvel's multiverse concept.

A Disappointment for Some Fans

This revelation has been met with disappointment from some fans who had accepted 'Ragnarok' as the official sequel. The story follows Sung Suho, the son of Sung Jinwoo, but Chugong's comments imply that this character and storyline might not exist in a future sequel penned by himself. The author has also mentioned that he is considering writing his own sequel, which would likely focus on Jinwoo again.

What This Means for the Universe

While 'Ragnarok' is still considered a canonical part of the wider 'Solo Leveling' universe, it now exists as a parallel story rather than a linear progression. This opens the door for Chugong to explore different paths and outcomes for his characters in future works, without being constrained by the events of 'Ragnarok'. For now, Sung Suho's story begins and ends with 'Ragnarok'.

Key Takeaways

  • Not a Direct Sequel: Author Chugong confirmed 'Ragnarok' is an alternate universe story.
  • Written by Daul: The sequel was penned by another author, not Chugong.
  • Fan Reaction: The news has disappointed some fans who saw it as the official continuation.
  • Future Possibilities: Chugong may write his own sequel, which could disregard the events of 'Ragnarok'.

articles.title: Solo Leveling Series Creator Hints at New Movie
articles.excerpt: In a new interview, the author of the Solo Leveling light novel, Chugong, has hinted that a new movie based on the series is in the early stages of creation.
articles.author: CBR
articles.fullContent:
'Solo Leveling' Movie in Discussion, Creator Hints

The creator of the hit series 'Solo Leveling', Chugong, has indicated that a film adaptation may be in the works. In a recent interview with the Russian digital book service LitRes, when asked about offers for film adaptations, Chugong responded, "As far as I know, there are many discussions taking place." This suggests that a movie project is in the early stages of consideration.

Anime Film a Strong Possibility

While the author did not specify the format, an anime film is considered the most probable outcome. With a live-action series already in development for Netflix, a separate live-action movie would likely conflict with that project. An anime movie could also explain the current lack of an official release date for the highly anticipated third season of the anime, as the production studio's resources might be focused on a feature film.

Author's Perspective

The discussion around a potential movie comes as the franchise continues to expand through games, a sequel manhwa, and the upcoming live-action adaptation. In the same interview, Chugong also shared insights into his creative process, revealing that his favourite arc to write was the Red Gate arc, which was previously adapted into a film titled 'Solo Leveling: ReAwakening'.

Future of the Franchise

Fans have eagerly awaited news on the continuation of the anime, which has achieved massive success and became Crunchyroll's most reviewed anime of all time. Chugong's confirmation that multiple projects are being discussed indicates a strong and active future for the franchise, with a movie now being a significant possibility on the horizon for Sung Jinwoo's story.

Key Takeaways

  • Movie Discussions: 'Solo Leveling' author Chugong has confirmed that "many discussions" about a film adaptation are taking place.
  • Anime Format Likely: An anime film is the most probable format, given the existing development of a live-action Netflix series.
  • Potential Season 3 Factor: The development of a movie could be a reason for the delay in announcing the third anime season.
  • Franchise is Growing: The potential film is one of many projects being considered for the expanding 'Solo Leveling' universe.

articles.title: Figure AI Unveils Humanoid Robot for Household Chores
articles.excerpt: Figure AI has introduced its third-generation humanoid robot, Figure 03, designed to perform everyday household tasks like folding laundry and washing dishes autonomously.
articles.author: Figure AI
articles.fullContent:
Figure 03 Robot Introduced for Home and Commercial Use

Technology startup Figure AI has unveiled its third-generation humanoid robot, Figure 03, a general-purpose machine capable of performing a wide range of everyday chores. In demonstrations, the robot was shown tidying rooms, serving food, folding clothes, and loading a dishwasher without direct human control. The company aims for the robot to eventually handle most household tasks autonomously by 2026.

AI-Powered Autonomous Operation

The robot's capabilities are driven by Helix, Figure AI's proprietary AI system that enables it to perform complex actions in real-time without following a pre-programmed script. This marks a shift from the company's previous reliance on OpenAI models. CEO Brett Adcock confirmed that the demonstration videos were not remotely operated, highlighting the system's autonomy.

Advanced Hardware and Sensory Input

Figure 03 features a completely redesigned sensory system, including a new camera architecture that doubles the frame rate and significantly reduces latency. Its hands have been updated with softer, more adaptive fingertips and integrated palm cameras, allowing for delicate tasks and precise object manipulation, even in confined spaces like cabinets. The robot stands 1.68 metres tall, can carry up to 20 kilograms, and has a five-hour runtime.

"Our goal is to deliver a truly general-purpose robot - one that can perform human-like tasks and learn directly from people." - Figure AI

Designed for Mass Production

Unlike previous prototypes, Figure 03 was engineered for high-volume manufacturing from the ground up. Figure AI has established a new supply chain and manufacturing process at its 'BotQ' facility, aiming to produce up to 12,000 units per year initially. This focus on scalability signals a move from experimental robotics to deployable products for both homes and businesses.

Key Takeaways

  • Autonomous Chores: Figure 03 can perform household tasks like folding clothes and washing dishes without remote control.
  • Helix AI System: The robot is powered by Figure's in-house AI, allowing it to learn and execute tasks in real time.
  • Advanced Hardware: It features an upgraded vision system and tactile hands for improved perception and manipulation.
  • Ready for Scale: Figure 03 is designed for mass manufacturing, with a goal of making humanoid robots a scalable product.

articles.title: JWST Uncovers Doomed Star Hidden in Dust Before Explosion
articles.excerpt: The James Webb Space Telescope has captured the first-ever image of a massive red supergiant star, hidden by dust, just before it exploded as a supernova, solving a long-standing cosmic mystery.
articles.author: Northwestern University
articles.fullContent:
Webb Telescope Solves Mystery of Missing Supernovae

A team of astronomers has used the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) to directly identify a supernova's source star at mid-infrared wavelengths for the first time. The observation captured a massive red supergiant, named SN2025pht, that was heavily obscured by a thick cloak of dust just before it exploded. This discovery helps explain why astronomers have rarely witnessed these types of stars going supernova, despite theoretical models predicting they should be common.

Piercing Through the Cosmic Dust

The doomed star was located in the galaxy NGC 1637, about 40 million light-years from Earth. While radiating 100,000 times more light than the sun, its visible light was significantly dimmed by the surrounding dust cocoon, making it invisible to telescopes like Hubble. JWST's powerful infrared vision was able to pierce through this dust, revealing the star before its cataclysmic end.

"Only now, with JWST, do we finally have the quality of data and infrared observations that allow us to say precisely the exact type of red supergiant that exploded and what its immediate environment looked like." - Charlie Kilpatrick, Northwestern University

A Landmark Observation

This marks the first time JWST has been used to confirm a supernova's progenitor star. By comparing pre-explosion JWST images with post-explosion images, researchers confirmed the star's identity. The finding suggests that previous supernova surveys may have missed many red supergiants simply because they were too shrouded in dust to be detected by optical telescopes.

Future of Supernova Research

This breakthrough opens a new era for studying the final stages of massive stars. With JWST's capabilities, astronomers can now identify previously hidden stars and gather a more complete picture of how they live and die. The team is now actively searching for other dust-obscured red supergiants that might be on the verge of exploding.

Key Takeaways

  • First Detection: This is the first time JWST has identified a supernova progenitor star, SN2025pht.
  • Hidden by Dust: The red supergiant was completely obscured by a thick dust cloud, making it invisible to optical telescopes.
  • Solving a Mystery: The discovery explains why red supergiant supernovae have been observed less frequently than predicted.
  • Infrared Power: JWST's ability to see in infrared light was crucial to piercing the dust and finding the star.

articles.title: Solo Leveling Season 3 Delay Caused by Studio Scheduling
articles.excerpt: The anticipated third season of the hit anime 'Solo Leveling' is delayed because the production studio, A-1 Pictures, is fully booked with other major projects until 2026.
articles.author: Screen Rant
articles.fullContent:
'Solo Leveling' Season 3 Delayed Due to Studio's Packed Schedule

The delay for the third season of 'Solo Leveling' is not due to production issues or lack of interest, but rather the busy schedule of animation studio A-1 Pictures. The studio is reportedly committed to several other high-profile anime projects, with its production pipeline fully booked well into 2026. This has prevented the team from beginning work on the next instalment of the popular series.

A-1 Pictures' Current Commitments

A-1 Pictures is currently handling multiple major productions, including the highly anticipated 'Fate/strange Fake' and other original projects. These commitments require the full attention of the studio's top creative talent, the same staff responsible for the high-quality animation of 'Solo Leveling's' first two seasons. The scheduling conflict means the studio lacks the available manpower to tackle another demanding project simultaneously.

Quality Over Speed

While the delay may be frustrating for fans, it is seen as a positive move to protect the quality of the series. A-1 Pictures is reportedly committed to bringing back the same directors and staff who made the initial seasons a success. Waiting until the team is available ensures creative consistency and maintains the high standard of animation, particularly for the show's complex and visually intensive battle sequences.

Future Outlook

Although no official release window has been announced, the scheduling challenges suggest that fans may not see Season 3 until 2027 or later. The delay is a strategic decision to ensure the final product meets the high expectations set by its predecessors. By allowing the creative team to complete their current projects first, the studio aims to deliver a third season that lives up to the series' reputation.

Key Takeaways

  • Scheduling Conflict: The delay is due to A-1 Pictures being fully booked with other anime projects until 2026.
  • No Production Issues: The hold-up is not related to funding, quality concerns, or creative disputes.
  • Maintaining Quality: The studio is waiting for the original creative team to become available to ensure consistency.
  • Potential Release: The third season may not be released until 2027 or later due to the studio's commitments.

articles.title: Casual Graphic Designer Position Opens in Perth
articles.excerpt: A casual role for a Graphic Designer is now available in Perth, focusing on the creation of marketing materials and supporting a broader design team.
articles.author: Jora
articles.fullContent:
Role Overview

A Perth-based organisation is looking for a creative and skilled Graphic Designer to join their team on a casual basis. The position involves working on a diverse range of projects, creating visual assets for both print and digital channels, and translating business goals into compelling visual stories.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop innovative designs for a variety of materials including web pages, marketing collateral, newsletters, and internal communications.
  • Collaborate with marketing and other teams to translate strategic direction into high-quality visual content.
  • Manage the design process from concept to final deliverable, ensuring brand consistency.
  • Prepare sketches, layouts, and finished artwork for both print and digital media.

Required Qualifications

  • Experience: Proven experience in a graphic design role with a strong portfolio.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency with design software such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign is essential.
  • Soft Skills: Exceptional creativity, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

What We Offer

  • A flexible, casual work arrangement.
  • The opportunity to work on a wide range of creative projects.
  • A collaborative and supportive team environment.

📍 Location: Perth, WA

Application Instructions

Interested applicants should prepare a portfolio showcasing their design skills and apply through the relevant job portal. The application should demonstrate both creativity and a strong understanding of brand identity.

Key Points

  • Role: Casual Graphic Designer
  • Key Requirement: Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite and a compelling portfolio.
  • Work Arrangement: Casual, on-site in Perth.
  • Focus: Creating visual content for print and digital marketing channels.

articles.title: JWST Finds Black Hole 'Scar' in Galaxy
articles.excerpt: The James Webb Space Telescope has found evidence of a massive black hole that ploughed through a galaxy, leaving behind an enormous cosmic scar.
articles.author: Live Science
articles.fullContent:
Webb Telescope Finds Evidence of Rampaging Black Hole

Astronomers have discovered a colossal 20,000-light-year-long "scar" of gas and dust that was likely carved by a massive black hole ploughing through a distant galaxy. The enormous linear trail was identified in the spiral galaxy NGC 3627, located about 31 million light-years from Earth, using combined data from the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) and the Atacama Large Millimeter/submillimeter Array (ALMA).

A Clearly Defined Contrail

The feature is the most clearly defined scar of its kind ever observed, stretching for thousands of light-years while remaining remarkably narrow at only 650 light-years wide. Data from JWST confirmed the trail is rich in dust, while ALMA observations showed it also contains a high concentration of carbon monoxide gas. The object responsible is estimated to be as massive as 10 million suns.

The Cosmic Cannonball

The leading theory suggests that as the massive object — most likely a black hole — shot through the galactic disk at incredible speed, its immense gravity squeezed gas and dust out from the galaxy, leaving the long trail as evidence of its passage. While a massive black hole is the primary candidate, researchers have not ruled out other possibilities, such as the dense core of a dwarf galaxy.

Insights into Galactic Dynamics

This observation provides a dramatic, real-world example of how massive objects can interact with and disrupt the structure of entire galaxies. The event, estimated to have occurred around 20 million years ago, is relatively recent in astronomical terms. It offers new insights into the dynamic and often violent processes that shape the cosmos.

Key Takeaways

  • Massive Scar Discovered: A 20,000-light-year-long trail of gas and dust has been found in the galaxy NGC 3627.
  • Likely Cause: A massive black hole, weighing up to 10 million suns, is the primary suspect for creating the scar.
  • Powerful Telescopes: The discovery was made by combining infrared data from JWST and radio data from ALMA.
  • Galactic Evolution: The finding provides direct evidence of how massive objects can violently alter galactic structures.

articles.title: Star Citizen Alpha 4.3.2 Patch Released to All Backers
articles.excerpt: Cloud Imperium Games has released Star Citizen Alpha Patch 4.3.2 to all backers, focusing on stability, bug fixes, and gameplay updates for the Public Test Universe (PTU).
articles.author: Roberts Space Industries
articles.fullContent:
Alpha Patch 4.3.2 Deployed to PTU for All Backers

The latest update for Star Citizen, Alpha Patch 4.3.2, has now been deployed to the Public Test Universe (PTU) and is available for all backers to test. The new patch brings a series of bug fixes, stability improvements, and adjustments to gameplay features, including updates to structural salvage and the in-game economy.

Key Gameplay Updates

This patch introduces several notable changes aimed at refining the gameplay experience. Key updates include adjustments to the pricing of Salvaged Materials (RMC) and construction materials, with RMC sale prices being reduced. Additionally, the Aegis Reclaimer has received elevator and docking updates, and new items such as the Nova gatling gun have been added to in-game shops.

Bug Fixes and Stability

A significant portion of the patch is dedicated to addressing known issues and improving overall game stability. The development team has implemented several potential fixes for bugs related to AI behaviour, tractor beams, and crafting with salvaged materials. These fixes are intended to create a smoother and more reliable experience for players participating in the PTU.

Testing Focus

Cloud Imperium Games has outlined the primary testing focus for this patch, which includes the stability of the servers, bug fixes, and the newly implemented structural salvage updates. Players are encouraged to provide feedback on these areas to help the development team identify and resolve any remaining issues before the patch is moved to the live servers.

Key Takeaways

  • PTU Release: Alpha Patch 4.3.2 is now available for all backers on the Public Test Universe.
  • Economy Changes: The patch includes repricing for RMC and construction materials to balance the in-game economy.
  • Bug Fixes: Numerous potential fixes have been implemented to address issues with AI, tractor beams, and crafting.
  • Gameplay Updates: New items have been added to shops and the Aegis Reclaimer has received functional improvements.

articles.title: Job Opening: Senior Desktop Engineer in Perth
articles.excerpt: A contract role for a Senior Desktop Engineer is available in Perth, focusing on providing high-level helpdesk and IT support services.
articles.author: Peoplebank
articles.fullContent:
Role Overview

A leading organisation in Perth is seeking an experienced Senior Desktop Engineer for a contract position. The role is centred on providing advanced IT support, managing desktop environments, and resolving complex technical issues to ensure smooth business operations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide Level 2/3 IT support for desktop hardware, software, and network issues.
  • Manage the deployment, configuration, and maintenance of desktop systems and applications.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex incidents related to operating systems, mobile devices, and peripherals.
  • Contribute to IT projects, including system upgrades and migrations.
  • Mentor junior support staff and develop technical documentation.

Required Qualifications

  • Experience: Proven experience in a senior desktop support or helpdesk engineer role.
  • Technical Skills: Expertise in Windows operating systems, Active Directory, Microsoft 365, and network troubleshooting.
  • Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities, excellent communication skills, and a customer-focussed approach.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience with ITIL frameworks.
  • Certifications such as CompTIA A+ or Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST).
  • Familiarity with virtualisation technologies.

What We Offer

  • A competitive contract rate.
  • Opportunity to work within a professional and dynamic IT team.
  • Exposure to a variety of technologies and IT projects.

📍 Location: Perth, WA (On-site)

Application Instructions

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via the official Peoplebank website or contact their Perth office for more information on the application process.

Key Points

  • Role: Senior Desktop Engineer (Contract)
  • Key Requirement: Advanced IT support and troubleshooting skills
  • Work Arrangement: On-site in Perth
  • Application: Via Peoplebank recruitment agency

articles.title: Tesla's Optimus Robot Learns Kung Fu via AI
articles.excerpt: Elon Musk has shared a video of the Tesla Optimus robot performing complex Kung Fu movements, stating the robot learned the skills autonomously through AI without being remotely controlled.
articles.author: Elon Musk
articles.fullContent:
Optimus Robot Showcases Autonomous Martial Arts Skills

Tesla's Optimus humanoid robot has demonstrated a significant leap in its AI capabilities by learning and performing Kung Fu. In a video shared by CEO Elon Musk, the robot is seen flawlessly mirroring the movements of a human trainer, showcasing impressive balance, agility, and coordination. Musk confirmed that the robot was operating entirely on its own AI and was not being tele-operated by a human.

A Leap in AI-Driven Learning

This demonstration marks a critical advancement from previous Optimus showcases, where the robot often relied on remote human control for tasks. The ability to learn complex physical actions simply by observing a human highlights the progress of Tesla's end-to-end neural networks, which process visual data and translate it into physical motion in real-time. This suggests the robot can now learn new skills autonomously through imitation.

From Popcorn to Kung Fu

The new capabilities stand in stark contrast to earlier appearances, such as serving popcorn at a Tesla Diner, which were later revealed to be controlled by human operators. The shift to autonomous learning is a key step toward Tesla's goal of creating a general-purpose robot capable of performing a wide variety of tasks without direct intervention. Musk has previously stated that Optimus could learn tasks by watching YouTube videos.

Future Implications and Production

Tesla plans to expand the robot's abilities further by integrating it with its Grok AI for conversational skills. Musk has ambitious plans for Optimus, having previously set a production target for 2025 and suggesting the robot will constitute a majority of Tesla's long-term value. As capabilities advance, the focus will shift to scaling production and integrating the humanoids into factory work and potentially daily life.

Key Takeaways

  • Autonomous Learning: The Optimus robot learned Kung Fu through AI by observing a human, without remote control.
  • Advanced AI: The feat demonstrates major progress in Tesla's AI and neural network capabilities for robotics.
  • Shift from Teleoperation: This is a significant step up from earlier demonstrations that required human operators.
  • Future Integration: Tesla aims to integrate Optimus into various roles, with plans for mass production.
